did.unittitle: Fallingbostel and Munster-Lager DP Camp Church Records

repository.corpname: Ukrainian Historical and Educational Center Archives

did.langmaterial: Primarily Ukrainian, but also German, English, Serbo-Croatian, and Polish.
did.abstract: This collection contains records of the Ukrainian Autocephalous Orthodox Church parishes in the Displaced Persons Camps in Munster-Lager and Fallingbostel, Germany, including official correspondence, sacramental records, relief aid distribution records, and a remarkable DP camp census list.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains records of the Ukrainian Autocephalous Orthodox Church parishes in the Displaced Persons Camps in Munster-Lager and Fallingbostel, Germany which provide a glimps into the life of Ukrainian refugees in the waning years of the DP era. It contains official correspondence, vital statistics records, relief aid distribution records, and a remarkable census record that provides a snapshot of the entire population of the Fallingbostel Camp on July 14, 1950.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: The Fallingbostel Displaced Persons Camp was located in the Lower Saxon town of Bad Fallingbostel, and served as an emigration/transit/resettlement center for displaced persons who were about to emigrate. The Munster-Lager DP camp was located in the small garrison town of Munster located approximately 40 km northeast of Bad Fallingbostel (not to be confused with the much larger city of Münster in North Rhine-Westphalia). It is not clear why the register book in this collection shares records from both camps. It is possible that they were served by the same priest in this time period.

arrangement.p: This collection is arranged in 5 series as follows:

did.unittitle: Fallingbostel Camp church correspondence and records

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Records of Fr. Serhii Gerus who served as prior at the church in the Fallingbostel Resettlement Processing Center. Contains correspondence with the central Church Administration, circulars, receipts, birth and marriage affidavits, civil marriage certificates, and emigrant lists.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Notebooks of financial records, including the church elder's records, income and expense records, and records of the sale of church publications and icons.

did.unittitle: Fallingbostel Camp church relief aid distribution records

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Records of the distribution of food aid from the World Council of Churches.

did.unittitle: Fallingbostel and Munster-Lager Camp church register book

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Baptism, marriage, and funeral records for the UAOC parish at the Munster-Lager DP camp (1945-1949), and baptism and marriage records for the UAOC parish at the Fallingbostel Emigration Centre (1948-1950). Also includes affidavits of pre-war baptisms and marriages, as well as loose Nazi and post-war government-issued vital records documents (1943-1948) that have been sewn or pasted in.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Handwritten lists of all residents of the Fallingbostel DP Resettlement Processing Center along with their ages and nationalities generated as part of a census taken on July 14, 1950. List is organized by block and signed by each block leader.
